Cyber Claw:




"Wait!" Cyber Claw snapped at Dinobot, a little louder than she needed to 
be. She mentally scolded herself for doing so. She'd learned to keep herself 
quiet near other bots. The only time she raised to voice that high was when 
she was giving Megatron a piece of her mind. That exactly was one reason she 
wound up in the forest, hunted.

She watched Dinobot carefully, making sure he didn't escape from her sight. 
She folded her arms and said gruffly, "Tell me a little bit more about 
Megatron's situations. It seems to me times has definately changed. I have 
been on the run most of my life and I loose track of these things."

It was odd to her. Over many months, or many years (she lost track of the 
time) Megatron had stopped sending his fliers after her, and the hunts had 
ceased. Day after day, she had wondered when the hunts would resume and 
Megatron would try to blow her head off because of her treachery. She knew 
he didn't take kindly to traitors, but that was she chance she took. She 
couldn't stand him no longer.

She watched--almost waiting for him to turn his head from her and go about 
his business, ignoring the sorry looking clone that was herself. Sometime 
Dinobot was a heartless slag, but so was she. Perhaps she was even colder. 
She would leave a wounded bot even if he had a chance, while Maximals had 
their morals and limits.
